author: draganrakita
content:
To have more efficient ACDE call about EOF it would be great if clients/stakeholder read Marius blog post and discord thread that got started. Claim is that EOF is not useful and it should be removed from Prague.

Short summary:
Solidity, Ipsilon, Reth, Besu supports EOF,
while Geth argues it should be removed from Prague,
i didn't see Nethermind or Erigon view on post,
while i am not sure if ethereumjs/vyper position changed or not. 

Thumbs up if this is the state. Or comment if something is not correct.

author: yoavw
content: That's indeed a general issue with EOA migration. If we reject the proposal on that basis, does it mean we agree not to pursue EOA migration unless it involves making ecrecover state-dependent?

author: lightclient
content: I think it means we agree we don't know how to safely do full EOA migration. Not saying we must make ecrecover state-dependent in the future, but it seems like the leading approach rn to ensure permit-like-things no longer work post migration

author: gakonst
content:
How can other teams assist the Geth team with security? Reth side we're pretty intimate with fuzzing and run a few things on CI. We don't have infra for long running campaigns but if there's things we should be doing I'm happy to get us going on it. 

It was great to get integrated into goevmlab, guido also wrote good fuzzers for revm, Sigp also helped us fuzz w geth and found a few issues on both reth and geth, so generally we're high context and just need a direction to help lift weight off people's backs
